entities.description: Weight used in the full analytic dataset adjusted for various demographic variables.
The final weight after calibration, product of ANALWTADJ and GEM weighting adjustment factor.
Variables used in the weight calibration in GEM that typically include demographic variables.
Interviews that meet the criteria for being retained for weighting and further analysis.
Respondent's reported lifetime use of one or more substances or drugs.
Initial question used to determine lifetime use of a substance or category of substances.
List of substances for which detailed questions are asked if lifetime use is reported.
Lifetime use of cigarettes as determined by the lifetime cigarette question CG01.
Additional substances including smokeless tobacco, cigars, alcohol, marijuana, cocaine, heroin, hallucinogens.

relationships.description: ANALWT2_C is the product of ANALWTADJ and the GEM weighting adjustment factor.
GEM weighting calibration uses demographic variables.
Lifetime use of a substance is initially determined by a gate question.
NSDUH survey includes a list of substances for which detailed questions are asked.
Substances list includes additional substances like smokeless tobacco, cigars, alcohol, marijuana, cocaine, heroin, hallucinogens.
Usable interviews include respondent's lifetime use of cigarettes.

triple_relationships.subject: ANALWT2_C
triple_relationships.object: sum of ANALWT2 on the full analytic file
